Content.BodyCopy:
The (X)HTML Editor uses Tiny MCE to provide a rich text environment for formatting content. The content generated with this editor is validated for (X)HTML compliance.

Click on a button below for instructions.

Expand All

Collapse All

Edit HTML Source:

"Edit HTML Source" is a tool for advanced users that know the proper use of the html language, and to transfer content from an existing html source.

Clicking on this button will bring up the "HTML Source Editor", which consists of the HTML code that generates the content found within the rich text environment of the "Web Content Editor". This same code will also be directly inserted into the web page. Be advise that any errors made by changes in the "HTML Source Editor" can case the web page to not render properly in most web browsers.

Transfer of HTML code

A user that has pre-written HTML code can copy and paste the code into the "HTML Source Editor". If you wish to change the content within any transferred HTML code, it is suggested to change content within existing text.

Cut:

The "Cut" button removes highlighted content to be placed in a new location by using the "Paste" button.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + x
For Windows Computers:           Control + x

Copy:

The "Copy" button copies highlighted content to be placed in another location by using the "Paste" button.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + c
For Windows Computers:           Control + c

Paste:

The “Paste” button applies content saved by the “Copy” or “Cut “ buttons to the location designated by the cursor in the “Web Content Editor”. Highlighted content will be replaced by the new content.

The “Web Content Editor” will attempt to use font/attribute settings assigned to text content.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + v
For Windows Computers:           Control + v

Paste from Word:

The “Paste from Word” button applies content saved by the “Copy” or “Cut “ buttons to the location designated by the cursor in the “Web Content Editor”. Highlighted content will be replaced by the new content.

This Paste function is specifically designed for content being copied from Microsoft Word Programs, which removes unwanted hidden material.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + v
For Windows Computers:           Control + v

Paste as Plain Text:

The “Paste as Plain Text” button applies content saved by the “Copy” or “Cut “ buttons to the location designated by the cursor in the “Web Content Editor”. Highlighted content will be replaced by the new content.

The “Web Content Editor” will strip all font/attribute settings from text content.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + v
For Windows Computers:           Control + v

Undo:

The “Undo” button will undo changes made to the content in reverse order of when the changes were made.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + z
For Windows Computers:           Control + z

Redo:

The “Redo” button will reverse the changes made by the “Undo” button.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Do not have a shortcut
For Windows Computers:           Control + y

Bold:

The “Bold” button will increase the font weight to a darker setting to highlighted text.

This is Bold Text.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + b
For Windows Computers:           Control + b

Italic:

The “Italic” button will change font style of highlighted text to italic.

This is Italic Text.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + i
For Windows Computers:           Control + i

Underline:

The “Underline” button will place an underline to highlighted text.

This is Underline Text.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + u
For Windows Computers:           Control + u

Strikethrough:

The “Strikethrough” button draws a line through the center of the text that is highlighted.

This is Strikethrough Text.

Superscript:

The “Superscript” button assigns the superscript format to highlighted text.

This is Superscript Text.

Subscript:

The “Subscript” button assigns the subscript format to highlighted text.

This is Subscript Text.

Ordered list:

The “Ordered list” button assigns a number at the beginning of each item of a highlighted list of text. Numbers are given in ascending order.

  1. Item a
  2. Item b
  3. Itme c

To make a list every item of content will need to end with a return line.

Transferring Lists from Word Documents

Often a list generated from a word document will not copy into the “Web Content Editor” as expected. What often happens is that a number character would be place in front of each listed item. Just remove the numbers and leading spaces, and highlight the list and click on the “Ordered list” button.

Unordered list:

The “Unordered list” button assigns bullet points at the beginning of a highlighted list of text.

  • Item a
  • Item b
  • Itme c

To make a list every item of content will need to end with a return line.

Transferring Lists from Word Documents

Often a list generated from a word document will not copy into the "Web Content Editor" as expected. What will often happen is that a dot character would be place in front of each listed item. Just remove the dots and leading spaces, and highlight the list and click on the “Unordered list” button.

Outdent:

The “Outdent” button will move lines of highlighted content to the left 30 pixels from its current position.

This is

Outdent

Text.

Indent:

The "Intdent" button will move lines of highlighted content to the right 30 pixels from its current position.

This is

The “Align left” button will align highlighted text along the left margin.

This text is left aligned.

Align center:

The “Align center” button will center highlighted text within the text area.

This text is centered.

Align right:

The “Align right” button will align highlighted text along the right margin.

This text is right aligned.

Align full (Justified):

The “Align full” button will fill the text area and align the highlighted text along the left and right margins. This is most commonly known as justified among word processor users.

This text is full aligned.

Nam lacus ligula, vulputate vitae dictum a, tristique nec felis. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Suspendisse suscipit euismod diam quis dignissim. Nam sollicitudin ipsum non quam pulvinar elementum.

Blockquote:

The “Blockquote” button indents and provides spacing around highlighted text to indicate that the highlighted text is a block quote.

The text below is in a block quote.

Nam lacus ligula, vulputate vitae dictum a, tristique nec felis. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Suspendisse suscipit euismod diam quis dignissim. Nam sollicitudin ipsum non quam pulvinar elementum.

The text above is in a block quote.

Insert horizontal ruler:

The “Insert horizontal ruler” Inserts a horizontal line that stretches from the left to the right margins of the text area.

The line below is a horizontal ruler.

The line above is a horizontal ruler.

Insert/edit link:

“The “Insert/edit link” button makes highlighted text/item into a link to another webpage, another location on the page, or enables a document/file to be downloaded.

First highlight the text/item you wish to make into a link. Then click on the “Insert/edit link” button, which will display the Insert/edit link window.

You need to decide on what link you wish to make and select the radio button for the link in the “Link To” area. This should supply the proper input fields you need for the link you wish to make.

Click on a link type below for unique instructions.

Internal: A link to a web page within the Content Management System
Page

The “Page” text field is where you enter the ID number (x######) of the CMS page you wish to link.

External: A link to a web page outside of the Content Management System
URL

The “URL” text field is where you place the URL or web page address. Most URL’s start with “http://www” at the beginning of the address.

Browse Button

If you are not sure what URL to use, you can click on the “Browse” button located on the right of the "URL" text field and browse for your web page. Click “Save Address” when done.

Document: A link used to download a document
Document

The “Document” text field is where you place the file address contained within the assets folder for your document. You will need to upload the document to the assets folder before it can be used.
You can upload documents to the assets folder by clicking on “Assets” in the CMS tool bar. You can also upload documents using the “Browse” button.

Browse Button

If you are not sure what file address to use, you can click on the “Browse” button located on the right of the "Document" text field and browse for your document. Click “Save Address” when done.

Anchor: A link to a spacific location in the same web page

To make a working anchor for a web page you will need an anchor link and an anchor.

  • The anchor link is a link the user clicks on to change the focus of the
    web page to view the anchor.
  • The anchor marks the location of where the view will focus.
Anchor

In the "Anchor" text field enter a pound sign (#) followed by the name of the anchor without spaces. This must be the exact same spelling that will be used for the name of the "Anchor".

Note: Just enter a pound sign (#) without spaces to make an anchor link that will focus the view at the top of the web page.

Anchors

The “Anchors” menu lists all anchors already made within the editor. Selecting one of these will fill in the “Anchor” text field with the selected anchor name.

Click here to learn how to make an Anchor
E-Mail: A link used to activate an e-mail client for a given email address
E-Mail

The “E-Mail” text field is where you place an e-mail address.

Shared Input Fields

Target

The “Target” menu determines how the linked web page will load.

  • “Open in this window / frame” will load the linked page in the same window as the current web page.
  • “Open in new window (_blank)” will load the page in a new window.
  • The last two options in the menu should not be used.
Title

Enter the title of the link or a small message in the “Title” text field. This will display on hover. Leaving this text field blank will not provide a hover message.

Class

The “Class” menu is currently not in use and should be left set on “-- Not set --”.

Unlink:

The ”Unlink” button removes selected links from the content.

Insert/edit anchor:

The ”Insert/edit anchor” button makes a marker that marks the location of where the browser view can focus.

To make a working anchor for a web page you will need an anchor link and an anchor.

  • The anchor link is a link the user clicks on to change the focus of the web page to view the anchor.
  • The anchor marks the location of where the view will focus.
How to make an Anchor
  1. In the web editor highlight the content you wish to make into an anchor. The title of a paragraph is most commonly used.
  2. Click on the ”Insert/edit anchor” button.
  3. Enter a name for the anchor without spaces, do not enter a pound sign (#).
  4. Click "Insert" when finished.
Click here to learn how to make an Anchor Link
There is a bug with inserting anchors when using the Google Chrome web browser. Use a different web browser to prevent this bug.
Insert/edit image:

The “Insert/edit image” button inserts images into the content area, and supplies an editing window to help aid in the use of images.

First position the curser at the location you wish to insert a picture, or double click on a picture to select the picture. Then click on the “Insert/edit image” button.

Then select the tab you wish to edit. Instructions for each tab is given below.

You can also click and drag the picture to a new location within the content view.

Click on a “tab subject” below for further instructions.

General Tab: Image selection and preview
Image URL

The “Image URL” text field is where you place the image file's address contained within the assets folder for your image. You will need to upload the image to the assets folder before it can be used.
You can upload images to the assets folder by clicking on “Assets” in the CMS tool bar. You can also upload images using the “Browse” button.

Browse Button

If you are not sure what file address to use, you can click on the “Browse” button located on the right of the "Image URL" text field and browse for your image.

Image Description

The “Image description” text field is a brief message or name of your image. This text will display if the image cannot be loaded into the web page.

Title

Enter the title of the image or a small message in the “Title” text field. This will display on hover. Leaving this text field blank will not provide a hover message.

Appearance Tab: Image size and position
Alignment

The “Alignment” menu aligns the content around the image according to the selected value. The most common practice is to keep this menu set to
“-- Not set --“.

"Dimensions" (Width/Height) and "Constrain Proportions"

The text boxes control the width and the height of the image. You will need to give a number value.

By having the “Constrain proportions” check box enabled, the changes in one box will rescale the other box value to keep the image size ratio.

Vertical Space

The “Vertical Space” text field adds space above and below the image by the amount of the entered number value.

Horizontal Space

The “Horizontal Space” text field adds space to the left and right of the image by the amount of the entered number value.

Border

The “Border” text field adds a black border around the image with the thickness of the entered number value.

Class

The “Class” menu consists of predesigned BYU-I attribute and format settings for content within the Web Content Editor.

Warning not all items listed are design to be used with images.

Style

The “Style” text field is the styling code used to style the image you are editing. You can make changes to the code in this text field to make more detailed changes. If an error is made in the style code, the style will not render to the image.

NOTE: The unit values of all measurements are in pixels.

Advanced Tab: Hover image control

Swap Image

The “Swap image” section enables the use of swapping images during hover state.
The “Alternative image” check box will need to be check on to enable the hover image ability.

For Mouse Over

The "Mouse Over" text field is for the image that will be viewed when the mouse is hovering over the image area.

For Mouse Out

The "Mouse Out" text field is for the image that will be viewed after the mouse leaves the hover state.

Browse Button and Image Selection

Refer to the "General" section above for information on the browse button and selecting an image.

Miscellaneous

The “Miscellaneous” section is made for advanced users and should be left blank.

Insert/edit embedded media:

The “Insert/edit embedded media” button allows the editing and insertion of multimedia files into Web Content Editor.

Insertion of media will be placed at the location of the cursor. Highlighting media within the content will allow editing the media properties.

You can click and drag media content within the content view.

YouTube   Media

A YouTube video can be inserted into the “Web Content Editor” by using the “Edit HTML Source” button.

If you do, you need to be aware that any flyouts, drop-down menus or other items that move over the top of the player may appear behind and not in front of the YouTube video.

If you choose to use the “Insert/edit embedded media” button to edit a YouTube video, you may introduce undesirable changes.

Learn to upload youtube videos.

Learn to embed youtube videos within the Ingeniux environment.

General Tab

Type

The “Type” menu specifies the type of media file: Flash, Quicktime, Shockwave, Windows Media, or Real Media, of the file being used. This selection will affect what options are displayed in the advance options tab.
It is important that you select the correct media type of the media file you are using or the media file will not work.

File/URL

The “File/URL” text field specifies the file address contained within the assets folder for your media file. You will need to upload the media file to the assets folder before it can be used.

Browse Button

If you are not sure what file address to use, you can click on the “Browse” button located on the right of the "File/URL Text" text field and browse for your media file.

"Dimensions" (Width/Height) and "Constrain Proportions"

The text boxes control the width and the height of the player. You will need to give a number value.

By having the “Constrain proportions” check box enabled, the changes in one box will rescale the other box value to keep the player's size ratio.

WARNING: If the width and height for the player is too small only a small portion of the player will be visible and the player could be rendered un-usable.

Advanced Tab

Advanced

The "Advanced" section should have little use for the general user and should be kept at default values.

Media Player Options

The values contained in the media player options are determined by the type of media selected in the “type” menu found under the “General” tab.

Click on a “media type” below for further instructions.

NOTE: Most player options available are best left on their default values. What are listed in the slide down menus below are options you may be interested in changing.

Flash
Quality

The “quality” menu chooses the quality level of the video. Be mindful that the higher the quality of the video the more of a need for a faster download speed for the video.

A good default setting would be the “best” setting.

Auto Play

Enabling will cause the media to play as soon as the page loads.

Loop

Enabling will specify that the media repeat indefinitely.

Show menu

Enabling will specify that the full Flash Menu appear.

Quicktime
Controller

Enabling will specify that the control bar appear.

Auto Play

Enabling will cause the media to play as soon as the page loads.

Loop

Enabling will specify that the media repeat indefinitely.

Kiosk Mode

Enabling will prevent the display of the Quicktime save option.

Shockwave
Auto Play

Enabling will cause the media to play as soon as the page loads.

Sound

Enable and Disable sound

Progress

Enabling will specify that a progress bar be displayed.

Windows Media
Auto Start

Enabling will cause the media to play as soon as the page loads.

Enabled

Enabling will specify that the control bar appear.

Show menu

Enabling will specify that the Windows Media Menu appear.

Fullscreen

Enabling will indicate that the Windows Media file should display as a full screen.

Mute

Enabling will specify that the Windows Media file plays without sound.

Play Count

Specifies the number of times a Windows Media file plays once it is loaded.

Real Media
Auto Start

Enabling will cause the media to play as soon as the page loads.

Loop

Enabling will specify that the media repeat indefinitely.

Shuffle

Enabling will sets the Real Media to play in a random sequence.

Controls

Enabling will specify that the full Real Media Menu appear.

Num Loops

Specifies the number of times a Windows Media file plays once it is loaded.

Inserts a new table  /  Table properties:

The “Insert a new table” button allows you to insert and edit tables in the Web Content Editor.

If you have a table highlighted, clicking on this button will activate the editing window for the table.

You can "Right click" on the table and select "Table properties" from the dropdown menu to activate the editing window for the table.

You can click and drag tables within the content view.

NOTE: It is best to fill in as much information in the general tab as you can, otherwise working with the table can become difficult.

Click on a “tab subject” below for further instructions.

General Tab:
Alignment

The “Alignment” menu controls if the table aligns agents the left or right margin of the content area or centered within the content area.

Class

The “Class” menu consists of predesigned attribute and format settings for tables. At this time these values are not programmed for use. Leave this menu set to "-- Not set --".

Table Caption

Enabling the “Table Caption” Check Box will allow you to place a table caption at the top of the table. Just click at the top of the table to enter and edit the caption.

Advanced Tab:
Unused Fields

The following fields are best left at default settings unless you understand how to use them.

  • Id
  • Summary
  • Style
  • Language Code
  • Frame
  • Rules
Style

The “Style” text field is the styling code used to style the table you are editing. You can make changes to the code in this text field to make more detailed changes. If an error is made in the style code, the style will not render to the table.

Background Image

The “Background Image” text field is where you place the backgrond image file's address contained within the assets folder for your image. You will need to upload the image to the assets folder before it can be used.

You can upload images to the assets folder by clicking on “Assets” in the CMS tool bar. You can also upload images using the “Browse” button, which is located left of the text field.

NOTE: It would be best to use an image that matches the width and height dimensions given to the table. It is also important to choose an image that does don’t conflict with the readability of your table's content.

Language Direction

The “Language Direction” menu aligns the content of all cells along the left cell’s margin (Left to right) or right cell’s margin (Right to left).

Border Color

The “Border Color” text field is used to insert a color hex value. For Example: #cfd0d4.

The color you select will fill in the outside border of the table.

You can also write in a color name such as “blue”. Note not all colors are displayed the same across all browsers when using color names.

If you don’t have a specific color’s hex value you can choose a color using the “Color Selection” button located on the left of the text field.

Background Color

The “Background Color” text field is used to store the color hex value, as explained in the “Border Color” section above.

The color you select will fill in the inside area of the table.

NOTE: If you choose to use an image as your background, this color will not replace the image.

Table row properties:

The “Table row properties” button changes properties that pertain to rows within a table. (Content alignment in cells) (Row background)

Click on a “tab subject” below for further instructions.

General Tab:
Row in Table Part

The “Row in table part” menu assigns the selected row to be a header, body or footer row. The row will move to the top, center, or bottom of the table and change height to reflect the selected label.

Alignment

The “Alignment” menu assigns the selected row to align cell content along the left/right margin, or centers the content.

Vertical Alignment

The “Vertical Alignment” menu assigns the selected row to align cell content along the top/bottom margin, or vertically centers the content.

Class

The “Class” menu consists of predesigned attribute and format settings for tables. At this time these values are not programmed for use. Leave this menu set to "-- Not set --".

Height

The “Height” text field changes the height of the selected row.

Advanced Tab:
Unused Fields

The following fields are best left at default settings unless you understand how to use them.

  • Id
  • Style
  • Language Direction
  • Language Code
Style

The “Style” text field is the styling code used to style the table you are editing. You can make changes to the code in this text field to make more detailed changes. If an error is made in the style code, the style will not render to the table.

Background Image

The “Background Image” text field is where you place the backgrond image file's address contained within the assets folder for your image. You will need to upload the image to the assets folder before it can be used.

You can upload images to the assets folder by clicking on “Assets” in the CMS tool bar. You can also upload images using the “Browse” button, which is located left of the text field.

NOTE: It would be best to use an image that matches the width and height dimensions of the selected row. It is also important to choose an image that does don’t conflict with the readability of your table's content.

Background Color

The “Background Color” text field is used to store the color hex value, For Example: #cfd0d4.

The color you select will fill in the inside area of the selected row.

You can also write in a color name such as “blue”. Note not all colors are displayed the same across all browsers when using color names.

If you don’t have a specific color’s hex value you can choose a color using the “Color Selection” button located on the left of the text field.

NOTE: If you choose to use an image as your background, this color will not replace the image.

Update Target Rows Menu

There is an unlabeled drop down menu located just above the “Update” and “Cancel” buttons.
This menu allows you to select what rows will be effected by the changes made in the editor.

Table cell properties:

The “Table cell properties” button changes properties that pertain to cells within a table. (Content alignment in cells) (cell background)

To edit a cell select the content inside the cell and click on the “Table cell properties” button.

Click on a “tab subject” below for further instructions.

General Tab:
Alignment

The “Alignment” menu assigns the selected row to align cell content along the left/right margin, or centers the content.

Vertical Alignment

The “Vertical Alignment” menu assigns the selected row to align cell content along the top/bottom margin, or vertically centers the content.

Height

The “Height” text field changes the height of the selected cell.

Width

The “Width” text field changes the width of the selected cell.

Class

Cell type

The "Cell type" drop down menu changes the demotions of the cell between being a header cell, or as default settings, a data cell.

Scope

Update Target Rows Menu

There is an unlabeled drop down menu located just above the “Update” and “Cancel” buttons.
This menu allows you to select what cells will be effected by the changes made in the editor.

Insert row before:

The “Insert row before” button insert a row above a selected row.

The row being created will mimic the settings of the selected row.

Insert row after:

The “Insert row after” button insert a row below a selected row.

The row being created will mimic the settings of the selected row.

Delete row:

The “Delete row” button will remove the selected row and its content.

Insert column before:

The “Insert column before” button insert a column to the left of a selected column.

The column being created will mimic the settings of the selected column.

Insert column after:

The “Insert column after” button insert a column to the right of a selected column.

The column being created will mimic the settings of the selected column.

Remove column:

The “Remove column” button will delete the selected column and its content.

Split merged table cells:

The "Split merged table cells" button removes a cell's behavior of spanning across multiple rows and/or columns, by splitting the cell into smaller cells that line up with adjacent rows and columns.

The content of the cell is placed into the top left cell.

Merge table cells:

The “Merge table cells” button combines multiple cells into one cell that spans across the rows and columns of the merged cells.

To select cells to be merged:

1. Highlight the content of the cell you wish to merge.
2. Click on the “Merge table cells” button.

OR

1. Place your curser in the top left cell and click on the “Merge table cells” button.
2. Input the given number of cells to the right (Cols) and below (Rows) of the selected cell.
3. Click "update" to merge the selected cells.

The content of all the cells combined will be entered into the new cell.

Font size (menu):

The “Font size” drop down menu will change the size of any selected text to an appointed size.

Styles (menu):

The “Styles” drop down menu consists of BYU-I personalized styles that can be applied to highlighted content.

These styles have yet to be determined.

Format (menu):

The “format” drop down menu presets a selection of heading sizes determined by the web browser. These are used to format selected headings and titles.

Toggle guidelines/invisible elements:

The “Toggle guidelines/invisible elements” is used to mark invisible boundaries and elements within the editing view.

This feature is best used with tables that do not use borders around cells.

Insert custom character:

The “Insert custom character” button bring up a table that lists non-keyboard characters that can be inserted into the editor view.

Help:

The “Help” Button give you access to the Web Content Editor’s help dialog box.

Find:

The “Find” button gives you access to the "Find" dialog box, used to find key words within the editor's content.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + f
For Windows Computers:           Control + f

Find/Replace:

The “Find/Replace” button gives you access to the “Find/Replace” dialog box, used to find key words within the editor's content and replacement the text with new text.

Select All:

The “Select All” button highlights all content within the Editor View.

Shortcut keys:

For Mac Computers:               Command + a
For Windows Computers:           Control + a

Toggle spellchecker:

The “Toggle spellchecker” will turn off/on the spellchecker tool. Used to automatically check for spelling, within the editor view.

When the spellchecker is active red squiggly lines will appear under misspelled words.

Clicking on the arrow will provide a list of languages to select a specific spelling dictionary.
